title: Bug 47910: ajc outjar jar file does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using the ajc outjar command, the resulting file should be a valid jar file. However, currently, if a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file is present inside the source directory, it is not included in the output jar file.
OB: When I call ajc sourceroots <mydir> outjar <my.jar>, an output file is created with a .jar extension.
EB: The output file should be a valid jar file containing the METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file from the source directory if it exists.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Use the ajc command with the sourceroots option to specify the source directory.
2. Add a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file inside the source directory.
3. Use the outjar option to specify the output jar file.
4. Verify that the resulting jar file does not contain the METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file.
